About me

Hi, guys! I am currently a senior undergraduate student in computer science at Zhejiang University, China. I work as a research intern in State Key Laboratory of CAD & CG, under the supervision of Prof. Deng Cai. I love machine learning and its applications like data mining and computer vision. My undergraduate research focus on recomendation and social network analysis.

This summer, I had my great pleasure to work with Prof. Yong Jae Lee and Prof. Ian Davidson at UCDavis.

Research Project

Object-tracking Benchmark

Zhejiang University
2013.12 to 2014.4

Implemented mean-shift and other principle tracking methods, evaluate performance on TB-50 Sequences.

Collaborative Filtering Algorithms for recommendation [code]

Zhejiang University
2014.7 to 2014.9

Built a collaborative filtering recommendation algorithms toolbox in C++, implemented K-nearest neighbor and probabilistic matrix factorization methods.

Personalized Tweet Recommendation

Zhejiang University
2015.3 to present

The current researches on tweet recommendation mainly focus on the content of the tweets and the interests of the receiver. We observed impact of publishers’ authority in social media information propagation and used tensor model in tweet recommendation to incorporate all the three factors.

Human Augmented Training Data in Learning To Rank [project page]

University of California, Davis
2015.7 to 2015.9

Pairwise learning to rank methods require a substantial amount of training to perform well. We employed localized annotations to synthesize pairs of training instance,achieved higher ranking accuracy via augmented training data

Face landmark detection

Institute of Computing Technology Chinese Academy of Sciences
2015.10 to present
